caption: Figure 2: Summary of the experimental results.
description: This figure summarizes the experimental results for both the profile-based algorithm (PROFILE) and the adaptive Pareto-optimal algorithm (ADA-PO), comparing them to the state-of-the-art Pareto-optimal algorithm (PO).  It shows performance ratios for worst-case sequences and real Bitcoin exchange rate data, illustrating the impact of prediction error and highlighting PROFILE's robustness and ADA-PO's dominance in certain scenarios.

caption: Table 2 ADA-PO (adaptive Pareto-optimal)
description: This table presents pseudocode for the ADA-PO algorithm, an adaptive Pareto-optimal algorithm for the one-way trading problem.  The algorithm incorporates a two-phase approach. The first phase handles rates smaller than the predicted maximum rate, prioritizing robustness.  The second phase, triggered when rates meet or exceed the prediction, leverages deviations from worst-case scenarios to maximize profit while maintaining robustness.  The algorithm dynamically adapts the threshold function to optimize performance across varying input sequences.
